Poor insulation: The tiny house may not have adequate insulation, leading to high energy bills and discomfort due to temperature fluctuations.

Difficulty in finding a suitable location: Finding a legal and suitable location for the tiny house could be challenging, as many communities have zoning restrictions and minimum size requirements for dwellings.
High cost of materials: Building a tiny house can be expensive due to the limited space for construction, which may require higher-quality materials to ensure durability.
Limited accessibility: The small size of the tiny house may make it difficult for people with mobility issues to navigate and access certain areas.

Maintenance and repair challenges: Due to the limited space and unique construction methods, maintenance and repair of the tiny house could be more challenging and time-consuming than a traditional home.
